definition: to rule/to govern/to manage/to control/to harness (a river)/to treat (a disease)/to wipe out (a pest)/to punish/to research
"water" radical in Chinese characters (Kangxi radical 85), occurring in 没, 法, 流 etc/see also 三點水|三点水[san1 dian3 shui3]
to bring under control/to regulate/to restore to good condition/(coll.) to fix (a person)/to prepare (a meal etc)
to prevent and cure/prevention and cure
autonomous region, namely: Inner Mongolia 內蒙古自治區|内蒙古自治区, Guangxi 廣西壯族自治區|广西壮族自治区, Tibet 西藏自治區|西藏自治区, Ningxia 寧夏回族自治區|宁夏回族自治区, Xinjiang 新疆維吾爾自治區|新疆维吾尔自治区
to provide critical care (to a patient or a diseased plant)
rule of law/to rule by law

sentences.english: The physician made a prescription against seasickness for him.
sentences.chinese: 医生给他开了个治晕船的药方。

sentences.english: A visit to the King of Medicine Temple in Dandong might cure you of all illnesses.
sentences.chinese: 到丹东的药王庙一游，可以治好一切疾病。

sentences.english: He had his habitual breakfast, hamburger and ham sandwich every morning.
sentences.chinese: 他每天早上都是惯常的早餐，汉堡包和火腿三明治。

sentences.english: Do you have a good remedy for fatigued eyes?
sentences.chinese: 你有没有好的治疗法可以治我疲劳的眼睛？

sentences.english: Electrical treatment will be good for your rheumatism.
sentences.chinese: 电疗可以治你的风湿病。

sentences.english: This is a pure Chinese medicine, a true panacea against hypertension.
sentences.chinese: 本品系纯中药制品，实为治高血压之灵丹妙药。

sentences.english: Please prescribe some medicine for the burn.
To change water into wine to heal the lepers and the blind...
sentences.chinese: 至于把水变成酒，治好麻风病和瞎子，他愿意干就干。

sentences.english: Where does Tianjin have administering knee osteoproliferation's?
sentences.chinese: 天津哪里有治膝部骨质增生的？

sentences.english: She but make him stay, cure the condition of the injury of night female phoenix completely like.
sentences.chinese: 她却请求着他留下来，将夜凰的伤势完全治好。

sentences.english: It is a new method for treating the disease with the ear acupuncture.
sentences.chinese: 用耳针治这种病，是一种新方法。

sentences.english: I'm not feeling well. Do you have some tablet for airsickness?
sentences.chinese: 我觉得不舒服。有治晕机的药吗？

sentences.english: As for the Dao of governance, both of them take the idea that human conducts should be in conformity with the Dao of heaven.
sentences.chinese: 在治道观上，两者均取推天道以明人事的思维取象。

sentences.english: One apple a day, keep the doctor away.
sentences.chinese: 每天一遍小苹果，医生都不敢治我。

sentences.english: You have to know how the trouble arose before you can deal with it.
sentences.chinese: 必知乱之所自起，焉能治之。

definition: to bring under permanent control/to effect a radical cure
to apply a treatment/to undertake a therapy
to take radical measures/to get to the root (of a problem etc)
correct diagnosis/to prescribe the right cure for an illness/to suit the medicine to the illness
